title: Deaths of Fort Lauderdale mother, daughter a murder-suicide, police say
content:
The deaths of a mother and her young daughter inside a home in Fort Lauderdale have been ruled a murder-suicide, police said Tuesday.
A family member found the woman and her daughter shot to death just after 5:20 a.m. Tuesday in a home along the 2000 block of Northwest 29th Terrace, Fort Lauderdale Detective Keven Dupree said.
Authorities have not released the names of the woman and girl, but family members identified them as Ericka Joseph, 46, and her 9-year-old daughter, Akili Joseph.
Joseph, a retired Marine, shared custody of her daughter, who was supposed to have returned to Colombia on Tuesday after visiting for the holidays, said Tony Williams, Joseph's brother.
Akili's father went to pick her up Tuesday when he realized something was wrong, Williams said.
"He was here to pick [Akili] up," Williams said. "The pickup routine was uncharacteristic — that's how we came about to learn [of their deaths]."
Crime scene tape sealed off the fenced-in yard of the home, which appeared to have hurricane shutters over at least some of its windows.
"My niece was a vibrant young girl and she loved sports. She was outgoing and smart," Williams said. "It's sad, a tragedy, and we still don't know what happened as of right now."
